revised_title: Assessment of Aortic Regurgitation Using Pressure Measurements
tldr: This article describes a method to estimate aortic regurgitation in a patient with aortic valve stenosis using static-pressure measurements from two catheters. The time-variation of the pressure gradient in the aorta is deduced, and the regurgitation is calculated as a percentage of total cardiac output. The method, which models the aorta as a rigid tube, may be suitable for routine diagnostic purposes.
